The co-worker would be incorrect in assuming that the new box costs less than the original because she is not taking into account the difference in volume between the two boxes.

The original box has a volume of 180 cubic inches, and because 144 inches is one square foot, the cost to make each original box is 26.4 cents, or 0.264 dollars, when adding 0.22 for 144 inches to the cost for the remaining inches, which is 0.044.

The new box however, has a volume of 330 cubic inches, and using the rule that 144 inches is one square foot, the box is 2.29166 square feet, and multiplied by 0.15 cents per square foot, the cost of the new box is 34.375 cent, or 0.34375 dollars, so the cost of the original box is roughly 8 cents less expensive.

¤ I just wanted to say excuse me for my response to the one of  last tests i took (technology in the classroom) i guess i was getting a little carried away with the point i was trying to make the real thing i was trying to say was that i really just was bothered by the fact that students have homework, and the fact that not all of us have the time to spend everyday for more than an hour studying for a test because we get home from school we qant to relax not spend more time doing work and by the time we get home to the time we get back from school there really isnt a lot of time to relax since most of us do sports and other after school activities plus dinner there really isnt enough time to just do hw and study and because of this fact many students dont even study and rely on what they remeber from calss to help them do this test and if they do study, they only can for a few minutes or so and the forget everything the day of the test due to stress ( an example of why we should be allowed to look over a study guide for less than 2 minutes before a test that way we have a good idea of what to prepare for since some of the questions arent the exact same as the are on the test than the study guide.) and when we get home from school we want to relax not do more work in a short amount of time before after school activities ad the average school day bedtime (9:00 PM) and espically on the weekends when we have a full day to do whatever we want and more time to relax. In fact, it would be better if students had homework on weekends since we would have more time to do it (not a lot of homework though because we still want to relax!) that way if the schools still wanted to keep tests we can study during weekdays, do homework on weekends (saturday or sunday), and then relax for the rest of the day! this will cause less stress in most students and students wouldnt have to stress over that they have to do their homework because its due the next day and if they dont they get a detention. If homework was given on just weekends students would have 2 days to complete a small amount of work and relax the next day and when we go back to school on monday, same thing applies with work packets over summer break the only thing is they really arent needed and students can deal without them to be honest, they really arent nessecary since teachers dont grade them and there is no punishment for not bringing them ( besides not getting ice cream or not gettng your name put in a raffle) sure they refresh the summer brains of kids but do you really think that some kids dont get stuck on certain math problems? Do you really think they remember something that was taught in the begging of the year? no! if anything these packets dont help at all because most kids just guess on these packets in reality

 

¤ so there really is no need for the math packets but kids can do with the language arts packets because its simple to just read 2 books over 2-3 months but i do ask that you consider making projects a little easier and smaller so its less stressful for students, that way more students would bring in a projec rather than deciding not to do one because the choices are difficult or confusing. if anything you should let students pick what they  want to do for a project! :)
